Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Compiler crashes when building an Android Project (OSX)" (#1674) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

Either compile the project using Visual Studio for Mac, or `msbuild` on Terminal. 

Android build tools tried: `27.0.3` and `26.0.3`.
Mono Frameworks tried: `4.8.0` and `4.8.1`. (Mono 4 is required to run legacy libraries).

### Expected Behavior

Compile and generate `.apk` file.

### Actual Behavior

On Visual Studio for Mac, an alert with "Fatal error" message appears, then it closes automatically (without clicking on OK button of the alert window).

On Terminal the following message appears (full output attached):


Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Bundle Assemblies Causes App To Crash on Startup" (#1672) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce Crash

1. Clone/download the "Bundle-Assemblies-Crash-Repro" branch of the FaceOff repo from GitHub: https://github.com/brminnick/FaceOff/tree/Bundle-Assemblies-Crash-Repro
2. Set the Android project as the Startup Project
3. Set the build configuration to Release
4. Build/Deploy to a physical Android device (I am using a Samsung Galaxy S5 running Android 6.0.1)
5. The app will crash after displaying the splash screen

### Workaround
1. In the Android Build Settings for the Release Configuration, set **Embed Assemblies in native code** to **false**
2. Build/Deploy to a physical Android device (I am using a Samsung Galaxy S5 running Android 6.0.1)
3. The app will run

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Added README.md for the errors/warnings" (#1662) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened pull request "[Android] Fix drawables to load using AppCompat and change ImageCell to use standard image loading code" (#2688) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###
- Change drawables to pull via appcompat 
- Change ImageCell to use ImageViewExtensions so that it benefits and just reuses the same image loading code.  Currently ImageCell isn't using the code that will reuse drawables and thus it will crash if too many rows are created with the same drawable

### Bugs Fixed ###
https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/1872


### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description)
- [ ] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [ ] Changes adhere to coding standard
- [ ] Consolidate commits as makes sense

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Enhancements] ImageCell image loading reuse" (#2687) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Currently all the ImageCell code on each platform doesn't reuse the image loading code that's used by ImageRenderer.  This will become more of a problem once GIFS are added but currently this causes the largest issues on Android because the coded that was added to pull from drawables isn't being used this if a user uses an ImageCell they will get an out of memory exception

### Expected Behavior
All image loading code should just use the same Utility functions to load images

### Actual Behavior
Image loading code is copy pasted around

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Fix issue #2634. Android: Draw no border if no BorderColor is set" (#2684) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

This is a fix for issue #2634. On Android, when no BorderColor is set, a white border is always drawn around a Frame. That is a regression bug introduced in 3.0.0

### Bugs Fixed ###

Issue #2634 

### API Changes ###

None

### Behavioral Changes ###

Android only: no border will be drawn around a frame if BorderColor is not set or is set to Color.Default. Previously, a white border was drawn

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description)
- [X] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [X] Changes adhere to coding standard
- [ ] Consolidate commits as makes sense

Android FrameRenderer doesn't seem to have any tests.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "UWP frozen & eating CPU" (#2681) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
After upgrading XF from 2.5.1.527436 to 3.0.0.446417 my app freezes in a particular screen after calling PushAsync / Navigate.

I managed to reproduce the bug in the attached project.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download & run the attached project
2. Click the button => Freeze
3. Downgrade the Xamarin.Forms package to 2.5.1.527436 => No Freeze

- IDE: VisualStudio 15.7.1
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - UWP:  16299
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms 3.0.0.446417
- Affected Devices: Windows 10 1709 (Build 16299.431)

### Reproduction Link
[XF.Bug.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1996345/XF.Bug.zip)

Opened issue "Xamarin.iOS Binding for native SDK gets "ObjCRuntime\Trampolines.g.cs" class file broken" (#4086) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
I implemented a Xamarin.iOS binding library using Sharpie for a mobile SDK native available for iOS only.

I ran over most of the documentation about Sharpie but I'm facing this issue when building the project:

* After creating the binding and use it for a Xamarin.Forms (iOS only) it It gets a compiling issue for a generated class file. 
* I'm able to fix it manually by changing the misinterpreted type to a "var" and that's it.
* Unfortunately, my CI pipeline can't do that so it gets broken builds too.

Output file in VS for Mac
../[ProjectName.iOS]/obj/Debug/ios/ObjCRuntime/Trampolines.g.cs

![Trampolines.cs](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/DZd9BKJWsAEsoDW.jpg)
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Xamarin binding project
2. Bring a .framework file
3. Use Sharpie for creating the Binding
4. Reference your new binding as part of a Xamarin iOS project (aka Xamarin.Forms flavored project)
5. Clean All and build the project

### Expected Behavior
Building the Xamarin Binding shouldn't bring up compiling issues on internal/generated tooling classes

### Actual Behavior
Local development build broken, CI/CD pipeline got broken too

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[msbuild] Adds minimum support for XM binding projects from VS" (#4080) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Minimum support means:
- Letting users open XM binding projects
- Building XM binding projects offline (not connected to the Mac)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[xharness] Create simulators if they don't already exist." (#4085) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Create any needed simulators, instead of relying on them already existing (or
someone manually creating them).

A nice side effect is that it will become possible to delete all simulators on
a bot (to reclaim space), and they'll be re-created when needed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[xharness] Don't make a potentially blocking call to enumerate device candidates in VerifyRun." (#4084) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Enumerating device candidates can block (if the devices haven't been populated
yet), so make the whole thing async-based instead.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[xharness] Wait for a build to finish even if it has started." (#4083) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Because build tasks might be shared between tests, and if another test already
started a build, this test must still wait until the build finishes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[xharness] Don't load simulators multiple times at the same time." (#4082) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody: Things become unpredictable (and bad) otherwise.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "NSTokenFieldCell and NSTokenFieldCellDelegate bindings" (#3913) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Xamarin.Mac AppKit API bindings for:

- NSTokenFieldCell: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nstokenfieldcell?language=objc
- NSTokenFieldCellDelegate: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nstokenfieldcelldelegate?language=objc

Both of these are effectively duplicates of NSTokenField and NSTokenFieldDelegate. Things to note:

1. I've duplicated the names 1:1 between the regular and cell apis for consistency
2. In the cell delegate I've used a `ref int` in GetCompletionStrings, while NSTokenFieldDelegate uses `int`. The [documentation](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nstokenfieldcelldelegate/1523818-tokenfieldcell?language=objc) for that parameter specifies it allows optionally returning by reference. I'm not sure about the NSTokenFieldDelegate binding's original rationale/context, but I can also include an overload for it with a `ref int` as part of this if y'all would like.

I ran the tests in apitest-unified, apitest-unified32, introspection-unified, and introspection-unified32:  all passed (excluding some NSCoding fails on unrelated types, and a lot of presumably unrelated 'unneeded or incorrect version' fails). Built from source and it instantiates fine. 

Also removed the sharpie warnings in AppKit's xtro-sharpie ignore file. Let me know if there are any revisions or anything needed.
